title: uche6215
author: uche6215
content: I will likely say that the scarcity of the new designed naira note is not a bad idea, but on the other hand it has also limitsQuote the spending rate of most gamblers here in our country Nigeria, I say this because in my area it has limit the gambling rate, before some gamblers will just receive their salary and the next thing you see them in a gambling shop. Now a gambler can not carry a huge amount of money like 500,000 or 1,000,000 naira to a local gambling shop to gamble. This scarcity of the new note has limited a lot of things, it's good and it's not also good. Please in your own opinion what do you suggest?

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: While I agree with your assertion, I would like to add that most of the bookies in and around my vicinity have quickly adapted to the current reality facing the country. They have gone on to apply for and get OPAY, MONIEPOINT, and the POS terminals of various commercial banks in a bid to see that business isn't affected. In addition, punters who are banked have switched to cash transfers, although I believe they will be wary of transfers to the Zenith bank accounts of these bookies. The category of gamblers who will be most affected in my estimation are those who wager <N1000 and the unbanked.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Even on local betting sites like nairabet, bet9ja, merrybet and most others, you can easily fund your account with credit cards like master card since many years ago. It won't be a surprise today even if online bank transfer and USSD code would work just like it works now while shopping on online shopping malls and sites like Jumia and Konga.

Now a gambler can not carry a huge amount of money like 500,000 or 1,000,000 naira to a local gambling shop to gamble. This scarcity of the new note has limited a lot of things, it's good and it's not also good. Please in your own opinion what do you suggest? I disagree with you chief... I don't think the scarcity of the new naira note has anything to do with the reduced number of gamblers in betting shops. Persons who bet 500k to 1M rarely place their bets in physical shops, and persons like that bet with their phones or laptops from their own personal accounts and they can easily fund their accounts with ATM cards, bank transfer, USSD, POS etc.  In my on opinion, the fuel scarcity has brought about the increase in prices of commodites in the market as well as transportation. So many persons including gamblers are cutting their expenses and reducing the way they bet.
